After [this pr](https://github.com/scalameta/scalameta/pull/1270), checking equality between `charOffset` and `lastUnicodeOffset` doesn't necessarily check if the last character is unicode literal or not accurately.
Because we restore 
`charOffset` to position of the head of unicode literal (last character) here https://github.com/avdv/scalameta/blob/be2de57ee3d4f2c48a06eba224b4614cb7058a7d/scalameta/tokenizers/shared/src/main/scala/scala/meta/internal/tokenizers/LegacyScanner.scala#L484

(And now we do that here https://github.com/scalameta/scalameta/pull/1627/files#diff-48fb066d7904375b28be745aec62851cR110)

It's hard for me to tell if this change is solid or not, but the tests pass so I'm happy to give this an LGTM üëç and hope for the best. If there is a regression then our tests are not solid enough. wdyt @xeno-by ?

Hey sorry folks I'm somewhat overwhelmed by meetings after coming back to work after ScalaDays. How urgent is this review? I'll need a bit of time to do it properly, because I don't remember these details off the top of my head.
